Welcome to FastAPI’s documentation!¶

REST API main¶

main.healthchecker(db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The healthchecker function is a simple function that checks the database connection. It returns a JSON object with the message &quot;Welcome to FastAPI!&quot; if everything is working correctly.

Parameters:

db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A dictionary with a message

Doc-author:

Trelent

async main.startup()¶

The startup function is called when the application starts up. It’s a good place to initialize things that are used by the app, such as databases or caches.

Returns:

A dictionary with the following keys:

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API repository Authusers¶

async src.repository.authusers.confirmed_email(email: str, db: Session) → None¶

The confirmed_email function takes in an email and a database session, and sets the confirmed field of the user with that email to True.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Get the email of the user

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

None

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.authusers.create_authuser(body: AuthUserModel, db: Session) → AuthUser¶
The create_authuser function creates a new user in the database.
Args:

body (AuthUserModel): The AuthUserModel object to be created. db (Session): The SQLAlchemy session object used for querying the database.

Parameters:

  • body – AuthUserModel: Pass the authusermodel object from the request body

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

The new user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.authusers.get_authuser_by_email(email: str, db: Session) → AuthUser¶

The get_authuser_by_email function takes in an email and a database session, and returns the AuthUser object that has the given email. If no such user exists, it returns None.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Pass in the email address of a user

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

An authuser object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.authusers.update_avatar(email, url: str, db: Session) → AuthUser¶
The update_avatar function updates the avatar of a user.
Args:

email (str): The email of the user to update. url (str): The new URL for the avatar image.

Parameters:

  • email – Get the user from the database

  • url – str: Specify the type of data that is expected to be passed in

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The updated user

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.authusers.update_token(user: AuthUser, token: str | None, db: Session) → None¶

The update_token function updates the refresh token for a user.

Parameters:

  • user – AuthUser: Get the user’s id

  • token – str | None: Update the refresh token in the database

  • db – Session: Update the database with the new refresh token

Returns:

None

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API repository Users¶

async src.repository.users.create_user(body: UserModel, db: Session, user: AuthUser) → User¶
The create_user function creates a new user in the database.
Args:

body (UserModel): The UserModel object to be created. db (Session): A Session instance for interacting with the database.

Parameters:

  • body – UserModel: Get the data from the request body

  • db – Session: Access the database

  • user – AuthUser: Get the user id from the authuser object

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.get_birthday_per_week(days: int, db: Session, user: AuthUser) → User¶
The get_birthday_per_week function returns a list of users whose birthday is within the next week.
Args:

days (int): The number of days to look ahead for birthdays. db (Session): A database session object that can be used to query the database. user (AuthUser): An AuthUser object representing the currently logged in user, who will be used as a filter on our query.

Parameters:

  • days – int: Define the amount of days in which we want to search for birthdays

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • user – AuthUser: Get the user id from the authuser table

Returns:

A list of users whose birthday is in the next 7 days

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.get_user(user_id: int, db: Session, user: AuthUser) → User¶

The get_user function is used to retrieve a user from the database. It takes in an integer representing the id of the user, a Session object for connecting to the database, and an AuthUser object representing who is making this request. It returns a User object.

Parameters:

  • user_id – int: Specify the id of the user to get

  • db – Session: Access the database

  • user – AuthUser: Ensure that the user is authorized to get the requested user

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.get_users(skip: int, limit: int, db: Session, user: AuthUser) → List[User]¶

The get_users function returns a list of users from the database.

Parameters:

  • skip – int: Skip a number of users in the database

  • limit – int: Limit the number of users returned

  • db – Session: Access the database

  • user – AuthUser: Get the user id from the token

Returns:

A list of user objects

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.get_users_by_some_info(some_info: str, db: Session, user: AuthUser) → List[User]¶
The get_users_by_some_info function takes a string and returns all users that have the string in their first name, second name or email.
Args:

some_info (str): The search term to be used for finding users. db (Session): A database session object. user (AuthUser): An AuthUser object representing the current user of the application.

Parameters:

  • some_info – str: Search for a user by first name, second name or email

  • db – Session: Access the database

  • user – AuthUser: Get the id of the user who is logged in

Returns:

A list of users whose first name, second name or email matches the search query

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.remove_user(user_id: int, db: Session, user: AuthUser) → User | None¶
The remove_user function removes a user from the database.
Args:

user_id (int): The id of the user to be removed. db (Session): A connection to the database. authuser (AuthUser): The authenticated User object that is making this request.

Parameters:

  • user_id – int: Identify the user to be deleted

  • db – Session: Access the database

  • user – AuthUser: Make sure that the user who is trying to delete a user has permission to do so

Returns:

The user that was deleted, or none if no such user exists

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.update_user(user_id: int, body: UserModel, db: Session, user: AuthUser) → User | None¶
The update_user function updates a user in the database.
Args:

user_id (int): The id of the user to update. body (UserModel): The updated User object with new values for each field.

Parameters:

  • user_id – int: Identify the user that is being updated

  • body – UserModel: Pass the json data from the request to update_user function

  • db – Session: Get the database session

  • user – AuthUser: Check if the user is logged in and has permission to update the user

Returns:

The updated user

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API repository Auth(routes)¶

async src.routes.auth.confirmed_email(token: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The confirmed_email function is used to confirm a user’s email address.

It takes the token from the URL and uses it to get the user’s email address. The function then checks if there is a user with that email in our database, and if not, returns an error message. If there is a matching record in our database, we check whether or not their account has already been confirmed;

if so, we return another message saying as much; otherwise we update their record by setting confirmed=True.

Parameters:

  • token – str: Get the token from the url

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A message to the user that their email is already confirmed

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(NoneType), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The login function is used to authenticate a user.

It takes in the username and password of the user, and returns an access token if successful. The access token can be used to make authenticated requests for data from the API.

Parameters:

  • body – OAuth2PasswordRequestForm: Get the username and password from the request body

  • db – Session: Get a database session from the dependency injection container

Returns:

A dictionary with the access token, refresh token and a bearer type

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Security(HTTPBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The refresh_token function is used to refresh the access token.

The function takes in a refresh token and returns an access_token, a new refresh_token, and the type of token. If the user’s current refresh_token does not match what was passed into this function then it will return an error.

Parameters:

  • credentials – HTTPAuthorizationCredentials: Get the token from the request header

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A dictionary with the access_token, refresh_token and token type

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.request_email(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The request_email function is used to send an email to the user with a link that will allow them to confirm their account. The function takes in a RequestEmail object, which contains the email of the user who wants to confirm their account. It then checks if there is already an unconfirmed account associated with that email address, and if so it sends an email containing a confirmation link.

Parameters:

  • body – RequestEmail: Get the email from the request body

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background tasks queue

  • request – Request: Get the base_url of the application

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A dict with a message key

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.signup(body: AuthUserModel, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The signup function creates a new user in the database.

It takes an AuthUserModel object as input, which contains the username and email of the new user. The password is hashed using Argon2 before being stored in the database. A background task is created to send a confirmation email to the newly registered user.

Parameters:

  • body – AuthUserModel: Get the data from the request body

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background queue

  • request – Request: Get the base url of the application

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A dictionary, which is not a valid response

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API repository Avatar(routes)¶

async src.routes.avatar.read_authusers_me(current_user: AuthUser = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The read_authusers_me function is a GET endpoint that returns the current user’s information.

Parameters:

current_user – AuthUser: Get the current user

Returns:

The current user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.avatar.update_avatar_authuser(file: UploadFile = File(PydanticUndefined), current_user: AuthUser = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The update_avatar_authuser function updates the avatar of an authenticated user.

The function takes in a file, current_user and db as parameters. It then uploads the file to cloudinary using the public id which is a combination of username and id. It then returns an updated user object.

Parameters:

  • file – UploadFile: Upload the image file to the cloudinary server

  • current_user – AuthUser: Get the current user

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

The user

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API repository Users(routes)¶

async src.routes.users.read_users(skip: int = 0, limit: int = 100, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: AuthUser = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The read_users function returns a list of users.

Parameters:

  • skip – int: Skip a number of users

  • limit – int: Specify the maximum number of users to return

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the repository

  • current_user – AuthUser: Get the current user from the database

Returns:

A list of users

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API repository Auth¶

class src.services.auth.Auth¶

Bases: object

ALGORITHM = 'HS256'¶
SECRET_KEY = 'secret_key'¶
async create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶
The create_access_token function creates a new access token.
Args:

data (dict): A dictionary containing the claims to be encoded in the JWT. expires_delta (Optional[float]): An optional parameter specifying how long, in seconds,

the access token should last before expiring. If not specified, it defaults to 15 minutes.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass the data that is to be encoded in the access token

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the expiration time of the token

Returns:

An encoded access token

Doc-author:

Trelent

create_email_token(data: dict)¶

The create_email_token function takes a dictionary of data and returns a token. The token is created by encoding the data with the SECRET_KEY and ALGORITHM, and adding an iat (issued at) timestamp and exp (expiration) timestamp to it.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass in the data that will be encoded into a token

Returns:

A token that is encoded with the data passed to it

Doc-author:

Trelent

async create_refresh_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶
The create_refresh_token function creates a refresh token for the user.
Args:

data (dict): A dictionary containing the user’s id and username. expires_delta (Optional[float]): The number of seconds until the token expires, defaults to None.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass the user’s data to be encoded

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the expiration time for the refresh token

Returns:

A refresh token that is encoded using the jwt library

Doc-author:

Trelent

async decode_refresh_token(refresh_token: str)¶

The decode_refresh_token function is used to decode the refresh token. It takes a refresh_token as an argument and returns the email of the user if it’s valid. If not, it raises an HTTPException with status code 401 (UNAUTHORIZED) and detail ‘Could not validate credentials’.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • refresh_token – str: Pass the refresh token to the function

Returns:

The email address of the user who owns the refresh token

Doc-author:

Trelent

async get_current_user(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The get_current_user function is a dependency that will be used in the

protected endpoints. It takes a token as an argument and returns the user if it’s valid, otherwise raises an HTTPException with status code 401.

Parameters:

  • self – Make the function a method of the class

  • token – str: Get the token from the request

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async get_email_from_token(token: str)¶

The get_email_from_token function takes a token as an argument and returns the email address associated with that token. The function uses the jwt library to decode the token, which is then used to return the email address.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • token – str: Pass in the token that is sent to the user’s email

Returns:

The email of the user that is encoded in the token

Doc-author:

Trelent

get_password_hash(password: str)¶

The get_password_hash function takes a password as input and returns the hash of that password. The hash is generated using the pwd_context object, which is an instance of Flask-Bcrypt’s Bcrypt class.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • password – str: Pass in the password that is being hashed

Returns:

A hash of the password

Doc-author:

Trelent

oauth2_scheme = <fastapi.security.oauth2.OAuth2PasswordBearer object>¶
pwd_context = <CryptContext>¶
r = Redis<ConnectionPool<Connection<host=localhost,port=6379,db=0>>>¶
verify_password(plain_password, hashed_password)¶

The verify_password function takes a plain-text password and hashed password as arguments. It then uses the pwd_context object to verify that the plain-text password matches the hashed one.

Parameters:

  • self – Make the method a bound method

  • plain_password – Pass in the password that is entered by the user

  • hashed_password – Check the password that is being entered by the user

Returns:

True or false

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API repository Email¶

async src.services.email.send_email(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str)¶
The send_email function sends an email to the user with a link to confirm their email address.
The function takes in three parameters:

-email: EmailStr, the user’s email address. -username: str, the username of the user who is registering for an account. This will be used in a greeting message within the body of the email sent to them. -host: str, this is where we are hosting our application (i.e., localhost). This will be used as part of a URL that users can click on within their emails.

Parameters:

  • email – EmailStr: Validate the email address

  • username – str: Pass the username to the email template

  • host – str: Pass the hostname of the server to the email template

Returns:

A coroutine object

Doc-author:

Trelent
